name: Rankle for New York Times Games
bulletPoints: Deployed a web app to collect NYT game statistics (Wordle, Connections, etc) and return a weighted average grade.
Features OAuth account authentication, responsive design and interactive UI/UX.
summary: My first web development project that went from a simple HTML file with basic JavaScript to a full-stack React application with authentication, responsive design and modern UI. Became completely redundant after the New York Times released their own leaderboards, but it was still an incredibly fun project.

name: The Missing Dollar Mystery
bulletPoints: Developed a ready-to-launch private investigation game suiting clients' needs with a team.

Designed screen flows, distributed workloads among team, implemented key features: interactive clues, game timers, interfaces to communicate with OpenAI API, prompt engineering (30 realistic conversation topics, accurate end-of-game scoring and feedback to gauge player’s skill).
summary: A pixel-themed game used to train private investigators (and entertain the commonfolk) using JavaFX and OpenAI's GPT model. Developed for the semester-long SOFTENG 206 group project.

name: SESA x WDCC Hackathon 2024
bulletPoints: Awarded Most Over-engineered as a team; deployed a multiplayer spaceship crew simulator.
Built frontend player and death screens; integrated team member’s Chart.js code to main repository.
summary: A Jackbox-esque multiplayer spaceship crew simulator game. Players must communicate and collaborate with each other to obtain resources essential for the ship's survival. Three mobile web clients and a TV lobby screen connect to a server to manage game state. I did maybe 5% of the work (but definitely check out the amazing work of my friends).

name: Venue Hire System
bulletPoints: Designed and implemented a system in Java for storing and managing venues and their bookings that a real venue hire company could use.
summary: A terminal system written in Java for storing and managing venues and their bookings that a "Real Venue Hire Company"™ could use! Developed for a SOFTENG 281 project.

name: Customisable LOTTO Generator
bulletPoints: Intuitive GUI .exe application to randomly generate personalised Lottery numbers with options panel.
summary: My first Java development project. A GUI application for randomly generating Lottery numbers, based on New Zealand's LOTTO game rules. Comes with intuitive personalisation: add lucky numbers to always appear in your lines, play with Strike or the Powerball enabled, and increase your chances of winning! ("note: does not actually increase chances of winning"
